subject: GROWTH FROM SMALL BEGINNINGS
verse: Jesus asked, “How can I describe the Kingdom of  Heaven? What story should I use to illustrate it?  It is like a tiny Mustard seed. Though it is one of  the smallest of seeds, yet it grows to become one  of the largest plants, with long branches where  birds can come and find shelter .(Mark 4:30-32)
reflection: Jesus used this parable to explain that although Christianity had very small beginnings, it would grow into a worldwide community of believers. When you feel alone in your stand for Christ, real ize that God is building a worldwide Kingdom. He has faithful followers in every part of the world, and your faith no matter how small, can join with that of others to accomplish great things.
prayer: Almighty God, help us to trust in Your power to grow Your Kingdom from even the smallest seeds of faith. May we be encouraged to stand firm in our beliefs, knowing that we are part of Your vast community of followers around the world. (AI)

Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Jesus asked, **“How can I describe the Kingdom of *

*Heaven? **What story should I use to illustrate it? *

*It is like a tiny Must**ard seed. Though it is one of *

*t**he smallest of seeds, yet it grows** to become one *

*of the largest plants, with long branches** where *

*birds can come and find shelter .*(Mk. 4:30-32)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus used this parable to explain that although

Christianity had very small beginnings, it would

grow into a world-wide community of believers.

When you feel alone in your stand for Christ, real-

ize that God is building a worldwide Kingdom.

He has faithful followers in every part of the

world, *and your faith no matter how small, *

*can **join with that **of others to accomplish *

*great things.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: WHY SOME MAY RESIST IT
verse: Their judgment is based on this fact: The light from  heaven came into the world, but they loved the dark- ness more then the light, for their actions were evil.  They hate the light because they want to sin in the  darkness. They stay away from the light for their sins  will be exposed and they will be punished.  (John 3:19-20)
reflection: Many people don’t want their lives exposed to God’s light because they are afraid of what will be revealed. They don’t want to be changed. Don’t be surprised when these same people are threatened by your desire to obey God and do what is right, because they are afraid that the light in you may expose some of the darkness in their lives. Rather then giving into dis couragement, keep praying that they will come to see how much better it is to live in Light rather than darkness.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to embrace Your light and not fear the transformation it brings to our lives. May our example inspire others to step out of darkness and into Your radiant truth. (AI)
original_content:

===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verses:*

*Their judgment is based on this fact: The light from *

*heaven came into the world, but they loved the dark-*

*ness more then the light, for their actions were evil. *

*They hate the light because they want to sin in the *

*darkness. They stay away from the light for their sins *

*will be exposed and they will be punished. *

(Jn. 3:19-20)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Many people don’t want their lives exposed to God’s

light because they are afraid of what will be revealed.

They don’t want to be changed. Don’t be surprised

when these same people are threatened by your desire

to obey God and do what is right, because they are

afraid that the light in you may expose some of the

darkness in their lives. *Rather* *then giving into dis-*

*courage**ment, keep praying that* *they will come to *

*see how much better it is to live in* *Light **rather *

*than darkness.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: JESUS' RESURRECTION IS THE KEY
verse: He isn’t here! He has risen from the dead! Don’t you  remember what He told you back in Galilee, that the  Son of Man must be betrayed into the hands of sinful  men and be crucified, and that He would rise again  on the third day?” (Luke 24:6-7)
reflection:
Why is the Resurrection important? (1) Because Christ was raised from the dead we know
that our world is now headed for redemption not disaster. (2) Because of the Resurrection, we know that death has been conquered and we, too, will be raised from the dead to live forever with Christ. (3) Because the Resurrection gives authority to the church’s witness in the world. (4) Because the Resurrection gives meaning to the church’s sacrament of the Lord’s Supper. (5) Because the Resurrection gives meaning even in great tragedy (6) Because the Resurrection assures us that Christ is alive and ruling His kingdom, He is alive and well. (7) God’s power that brought Jesus back from the dead is available to us so that we can live for Him in the evil world.
prayer: Lord Jesus, we rejoice in the power and promise of your resurrection, which brings hope to our world and conquers death itself. May we live in the light of this truth, empowered by your living presence to be faithful witnesses of your kingdom. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1762aca42a51d43d
subject   : Subject: JESUS' RESURRECTION IS THE KEY (12-4-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 3 Dec 2020 16:47:47 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*He isn’t here! He has risen from the dead! Don’t you *

*remember** what He told you back in Galilee, that the *

*Son of Man must be** betrayed into the hands of sinful *

*men and be crucified, and that **He would rise again *

*on the third day?” *(Lk. 24:6-7)


*Today’s Reflection:*

*Why is the Resurrection important?*

(1) Because Christ was raised from the dead we know

that our world is now headed for redemption not disaster.

(2) Because of the Resurrection, we know that death

has been conquered and we, too, will be raised from the

dead to live forever with Christ.

(3) Because the Resurrection gives authority to the

church’s witness in the world.

(4) Because the Resurrection gives meaning to the

church’s sacrament of the Lord’s Supper.

(5) Because the Resurrection gives meaning even

in great tragedy

(6) Because the Resurrection assures us that Christ

is alive and ruling His kingdom, He is alive and well.

*(7) **God’s power that brought Jesus back from *

*the dead **is available to us so that we can live for *

*Him in the evil world.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: GOD'S SPIRIT AT WORK
verse: Godly Jews from many nations were living in Jerusalem  at that time. When they heard this sound they came running  to see what it was all about, and they were amazed to here their language being spoken by the believers. They were beside themselves with wonder. “How can this be?” they exclaimed these people are all from Galilee, and yet we hear them speaking in the language of the lands where we were born? (Acts 2:5-8)
reflection:
Christianity is not limited to any race or group of people.
Christ offers salvation to all people without regard to
nationality.
Visitors in Jerusalem were surprised to hear
the apostles and other believers speaking in languages
other than their own, the languages of other nationalities,
but they didn’t need to be, because God works all kinds
of miracles to spread the Good News, using many lang uages as He calls all kinds of people to become His
followers.
No matter what your race, color or nation ality or language, God speaks to you. Are you listen ing to Him?
prayer: Eternal God, help us to listen attentively for Your voice speaking to us in all languages and through all peoples, recognizing that Your salvation is offered freely to everyone. May we embrace the beautiful diversity of Your creation and work to spread Your Good News to all nations and cultures. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verses:*

*Godly Jews from many nations were living in Jerusalem *

*at that time. When they heard this sound they came running *

*to see what it was all about, and they were amazed to here*

*their language being spoken by the believers. They were*

*beside themselves with wonder. “How can this be?” they*

*exclaimed these people are all from Galilee, and yet we*

*hear them speaking in the language of the lands where*

*we were born? *(Acts 2:5-8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Christianity is not limited to any race or group of people.

Christ offers salvation to all people without regard to

nationality. Visitors in Jerusalem were surprised to hear

the apostles and other believers speaking in languages

other than their own, the languages of other nationalities,

but they didn’t need to be, because God works all kinds

of miracles to spread the Good News, using many lang-

uages as He calls all kinds of people to become His

followers. *No matter what your race, color or nation-*

*ality or language, God speaks to you. Are you listen-*

*ing **to Him?*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: EARLY CHRISTIAN RELATIONSHIP WITH JUDAISM
verse: They worshiped together each day at the temple, met  in homes for the Lord’s Supper., and shared their meals  with great joy. (Acts 3:46)
reflection:
The common misconception about first Christians (who were Jews) was that they rejected the Jewish religion. But these believers saw Jesus message and resurrection as the fulfillment of everything they
believed from the Old Testament. The Jewish believers at first did not separate themselves from the rest of the Jewish community. They still went to the Temple and synagogue for worship and instruction in the Scriptures. But their belief in Jesus created great friction with Jews who did not believe that Jesus was the messiah. So believing Jews were forced to meet in private homes for Communion, prayer. and teaching about Christ. By the end of the first century, many of these Jewish believers were excom municated from the synagogue.
prayer: Holy God, help us to understand and appreciate the faith journey of the early Jewish Christians, who saw Jesus as the fulfillment of their Scriptures and traditions, even as they faced opposition and separation from their community. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1763510a813fead1
subject   : Subject: EARLY CHRISTIAN RELATIONSHIP WITH JUDAISM (12-6-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 5 Dec 2020 16:40:53 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse: *

*They worshiped together each day at the temple, met *

*in **homes for the Lord’s Supper., and shared their meals *

*with great joy. *(Acts. 3:46)



*Today’s reflection:*

The common misconception about first Christians

(who were Jews) was that they rejected the Jewish

religion. But these believers saw Jesus message and

resurrection as the fulfilment of everything they

believed from the Old Testament. The Jewish believers

at first did not separate themselves from the rest of the

Jewish community. They still went to the Temple and synagogue for worship
and instruction in the Scriptures.

But their belief in Jesus created great friction with Jews

who did not believe that Jesus *was the messiah.* So believing

Jews were forced to meet in private homes for Communion, prayer. and
teaching about Christ. *By the end of the first century, many* *of these
Jewish believers were excom-*

*municated from the synagogue.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: A PAINFUL DEPARTURE
verse: Now turn from your sins and turn to God, so that  you can be cleansed of your sins. (Acts 3:19)
reflection:
When we turn from sin, God promises not only to cleanse us of sins but to bring spiritual refresh ment. Turning away from sin may at first seem painful because it is hard to break old habits and give up certain sins. But God will give you a better way, as Hosea Promised, “Oh that we
might know the Lord! Let us press on to know Him! Then He will respond to us as surely as the rising of the sun or the coming of the rains in early spring.” (Hosea 6:3). Do you feel a need to be refreshed?
prayer: Merciful God, cleanse us from our sins and refresh our spirits as we turn to You. Help us press on to know You more deeply, responding to Your grace as surely as the dawn breaks or spring rains fall. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1763a31c9b288484
subject   : Subject: A PAINFUL DEPARTURE (12-7-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 6 Dec 2020 16:35:10 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Now turn from your sins and turn to God, so that *

*you can **be cleansed of your sins. *(Acts. 3:19)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When we turn from sin, God promises not only

to cleanse us of sins but to bring spiritual refresh-

ment. Turning away from sin may at first seem

painful because it is hard to break old habits and

give up certain sins. But God will give you a

better way, as Hosea Promised, “Oh that we

might know the Lord! Let us press on to know

Him! Then He will respond to us as surely as

the rising of the sun or the coming of the rains

in early spring.” (Hosea 6:3). *Do you feel a *

*need to be refreshed?*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: GOD'S WISHES
verse: The sacrifice you want is a broken spirit. A broken and repentant heart, O God, You will not despise. (Psalm 51:17)
reflection:
God wants a broken spirit and a broken and repentant heart.
You can never please God by outward actions-no matter how good if your heart attitude is not right. Are you sorry for your sins? Do you genuinely intend to stop? God is pleased by this kind of repentance!
prayer: Holy God, we come before You with broken spirits and repentant hearts, acknowledging our sins and seeking Your forgiveness. Help us to turn from our wrongdoing and align our hearts with Your will, knowing that true repentance pleases You more than any outward action. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1763f1c40d60bc23
subject   : Subject: GOD'S WISHES (12-8-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Mon, 7 Dec 2020 15:29:45 -0600

*Today’s Verse:*

*The sacrifice you want is a broken spirit. A broken **and **repentant
heart, O God, You will not despise. *(Ps. 51:17)

*Today’s Reflection:*

God wants a broken spirit *and* a broken and repentant heart. You can never
please God

by outward actions—no matter how good—

if your heart attitude is not right. Are you

sorry for your sins? Do you genuinely

intend to stop? *God is pleased by this *

*kind of repentance!*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: LIGHT IN OUR DARKNESS
verse: The Lord is my light and my salvation—so why should I be afraid? The Lord protects me from  danger—so why should I tremble? (Psalm 27:1)
reflection:
Fear is a dark shadow that envelops us and ultimately imprisons us within ourselves. Each of us has been a prisoner of fear at one time or another-fear of rejection,
misunderstanding, uncertainty, sickness, or even death. But we can conquer fear by using the bright liberating light of the Lord, who brings salvation. If we want to dispel the darkness of fear, let us remember the psalmist that “the Lord is my light and my salvation.”
prayer: Eternal God, shine Your liberating light into the dark shadows of our fears, dispelling our anxieties and freeing us from the prison of our own doubts. May we find courage and strength in Your salvation, trusting that You are always with us. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 176449677502cbd0
subject   : Subject: LIGHT IN OUR DARKNESS (12-9-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord is my light and my salvation—so why*

*should I **be afraid? The Lord protects me from *

*danger—so why **should I tremble? *(Ps. 27:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Fear is a dark shadow that envelops us and

ultimately imprisons us within ourselves.

Each of us has been a prisoner of fear at

one time or another—fear of rejection,

misunderstanding, uncertainty, sickness,

or even death. But we can conquer fear by

using the bright liberating light of the Lord,

who brings salvation. If we want to dispel

the darkness of fear, let us remember the

psalmist that “*the Lord is my light and *

*my salvation*.”

* Pastor Sather *

subject: THE CONSEQUENCE OF REJECTING THE HOLY SPIRIT
verse:
Dear friends, if we deliberately continue sinning after we have received the full knowledge of the truth, there is no other sacrifice that will cover these sins.
(Hebrews 10:26)
reflection:
When people deliberately reject Christ’s offer of
salvation, the reject God’s most precious gift
they ignore the leading of the Holy Spirit, the
One who communicates to us God’s saving love.
This warning was given to the Jewish Christians
who were tempted to reject Christ for another
religion or, having understood Christ’s atoning
work. If anyone deliberately rejects the sacrifice
of Christ after clearly understanding the Good
News teaching about it, that there is no way for
that person to be saved, because God does not provide any other name in all of heaven for people to call on to save them.
prayer: Merciful God, we humbly ask for Your guidance to help those who may be tempted to reject Christ's offer of salvation, and we pray for the softening of hearts that they may receive Your precious gift of grace. May the Holy Spirit continue to work in the lives of all, drawing them closer to Your saving love through Jesus Christ. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17649a311948fed8
subject   : Subject: THE CONSEQUENCE OF REJECTING THE HOLY SPIRIT (12-10-20)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Dear friends, if we deliberately continue sinning*

*after we have received the full knowledge of the*

*truth, there is no other sacrifice that will cover*

*these sins*. (Heb. 10:26)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When people deliberately reject Christ’s offer of

salvation, the reject God’s most precious gift

they ignore the leading of the Holy Spirit, the

One who communicates to us God’s saving love.

This warning was given to the Jewish Christians

who were tempted to reject Christ for another

religion or, having understood Christ’s atoning

work. If anyone deliberately rejects the sacrifice

of Christ after clearly understanding the Good

News teaching about it, that there is no way for

that person to be saved, because *God does not*

*provide any other name in all of heaven for*

*people to call on to save them.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: POWER TO DO HIS WILL
verse: For I can do everything with the help of Christ who gives me the strength I need.. (Philippians 4:13)
reflection:
Can we really do everything? The power we receive
in union with Christ is sufficient to do His will and
to face the challenges that arise from our commitment
to do it. He does not grant us superhuman ability to
accomplish anything we can imagine without regard
to His interests. As we contend for the faith, we will
face troubles, pressures, and trials. As they come, ask Christ to strengthen you.
prayer: Gracious God, grant us the strength and courage to face the challenges that arise as we strive to do Your will and contend for the faith. May we always turn to You for the power we need to persevere through trials and pressures, trusting in Your sufficiency rather than our own abilities. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1764eba6cf81977c
subject   : Subject: POWER TO DO HIS WILL (12-11-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 10 Dec 2020 16:16:49 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*For I can do everything with the help of Christ who*

* gives me the strength I need.. *(Phil. 4:13)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Can we really do everything? The power we receive

in union with Christ is sufficient to do His will *and*

to face the challenges that arise from our commitment

to do it. He does not grant us superhuman ability to

accomplish anything we can imagine without regard

to His interests. As we contend for the faith, we will

face troubles, pressures, and trials. *As they come, ask*

* Christ to strengthen you.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: A SPIRITUAL THRIST
verse: God has made everything beautiful for its own time. He has planted eternity in the human heart, but even so people cannot see the whole  scope of God’s work from beginning to end. (Ecclesiastes 3:11)
reflection:
God has “planted eternity in the human heart.”
This means that we can never be completely
satisfied with earthly pleasures and pursuits. Because we are created in God image, (1) we
have a spiritual thirst, (2) we have eternal
value, and (3) nothing but the eternal God
can truly satisfy us. He has built in us a rest less yearning for the kind of perfect world
that can only be found in His perfect rule.
He has given us a glimpse of His creation.
But it is only a glimpse;
we cannot see into
the future or comprehend everything. SO we must trust him now and do His work on earth.
prayer: Almighty God, we thank You for planting eternity in our hearts and giving us a glimpse of Your perfect creation. Help us to trust in You and faithfully do Your work on earth, knowing that only You can truly satisfy our deepest longings. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1765435e12aaa57d
subject   : Subject: A SPIRITUAL THRIST (12-12-20)

date      : Fri, 11 Dec 2020 17:49:46 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*God has made everything beautiful for its own*

* time. He has planted eternity in the human*

* heart, but even so people cannot see the whole *

*scope of God’s work from beginning to end.*

(Eccl. 3:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God has “planted eternity in the human heart.”

This means that we can never be completely

satisfied with earthly pleasures and pursuits.

Because we are created in God image, (1) we

have a spiritual thirst, (2) we have eternal

value, and (3) nothing but the eternal God

can truly satisfy us. He has built in us a rest-

less yearning for the kind of perfect world

that can only be found in His perfect rule.

He has given us a glimpse of His creation.

*But* it is only a glimpse; we cannot see into

the future or comprehend everything. *SO *

*we must trust him now* * and do His work *

*on earth.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: THE SUBTLE TRAP
verse: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth,  where moth and rust doth corrupt. (Matthew 6:19)
reflection:
I think we all have heard of people who have become rich, and then lost everything. Even an average person can spend an inheritance or a paycheck-with lightening speed, and have little to show for it. My advice is don’t
waste your time chasing fleeting earthly trea sures. Instead, store up treasures in heaven, for such treasures will never be lost. (See Luke 12:33, 34 for Jesus’ teaching. Money seen as an end in itself, quickly traps us and cuts us off from both God and the needy.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to focus on storing up eternal treasures in heaven rather than chasing after temporary earthly riches, and guide us to use our resources wisely in service to You and those in need. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse: *

*Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, *

*where moth **and rust doth corrupt. *(Mt. 6:19)



*Today’s Reflection:*

I think we all have heard of people who have

become rich, and then lost everything. Even

an average person can spend an inheritance—

or a paycheck—with lightening speed, and

have little to show for it. My advice is don’t

waste your time chasing fleeting earthly trea-

sures. Instead, store up treasures in heaven,

for such treasures will never be lost.

(See Lk. 12:33, 34 for Jesus’ teaching.

*Money seen **as an end in itself, quickly *

*traps us and cuts us off from **both God *

*and the needy.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: TURN HATE INTO PRAYER
verse: You have heard that the law of Moses says ,“Love your neighbor” and hate your enemy. But I say, love your enemies! Pray for those  who persecute you! (Matthew 6:43-44)
reflection:
By telling us not to retaliate, Jesus keeps us from taking the law into our own hands. By loving and praying for our enemies, we can overcome evil with good. If we love our enemies and treat them well, we will truly show that Jesus is Lord of our life. This is possible only for those who give themselves fully to God, because only He can deliver us from natural selfishness.
We must trust the Holy Spirit to help us show love to those for whom we may not feel love.
prayer: Loving God, help us to overcome our natural selfishness and love our enemies as Jesus taught, trusting in the Holy Spirit to guide us in showing kindness even when it's difficult. May our actions reflect Your love and demonstrate that Jesus is truly Lord of our lives. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verses:*

*You have heard that the law of Moses says ,“Love your neighbor”*

*and hate your enemy. But I say, love your enemies! Pray for those *

*who persecute you!* (Mt 6:43-44)



*Today’s Reflection:*

By telling us not to retaliate, Jesus keeps us from taking the law

into our own hands. By loving and praying for our enemies, we

can overcome evil with good. If we love our enemies and treat

them well, we will truly show that Jesus is Lord of our life. This

is possible only for those who give themselves fully to God,

because only He can deliver us from natural selfishness. *We *

*must trust the Holy Spirit to help us show love to those* *for *

*whom we may not feel love.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: RENEWED CLARITY
verse:
Now we see things imperfectly as in a poor
mirror, but
then we will see everything with perfect clarity. All that
I know now is partial and incomplete, but
then I will
know everything completely, just
as God knows me now.
(I Corinthians 13:12)
reflection:
Paul offers a glimpse into the future to
give us hope that
one day we will be complete when we see God face to
face. This truth should strengthen
our faith. We don’t
have all the answers now, but one day we will. Someday
we
will see Christ in person and be able to see with
God’s perspective.
prayer: Lord, thank You for the hope that one day we will see You face to face and be made complete in Your presence. Strengthen our faith when answers are unclear, and anchor our hearts in the promise of Your perfect wisdom. Teach us to trust Your timing and walk by faith until the day we see with Your perspective. Amen.

*Now we see things imperfectly as in a poor mirror, but *

*then we will see everything with perfect clarity. All that *

*I know now is partial and incomplete, but then I will *

*know everything completely, just as God knows me now. *

(I Cor.13:12)

*Today’s Refection:*

Paul offers a glimpse into the future to give us hope that

one day we will be complete when we see God face to

face. This truth should strengthen our faith. We don’t

have all the answers now, but one day we will. *Someday *

*we will see Christ in person and be able to see with *

*God’s perspective. *

* Pastor Sather*

subject: WHAT'S FAIR
verse: When Adam sinned, sin entered the entire human  race. Adams sin brought death, so death spread  to everyone, for everyone sinned. (Romans 5:12)
reflection:
How can we be declared guilty for something Adam did thousands of years ago? Many feel it isn’t fair for God to judge us because of
Adam’s sin. Yet each of us confirms our her itage with Adam, by our sins every day. We have the same sinful nature and are prone to rebel against God, and we are judged for the sins we commit. Because we are sinners, it isn’t fairness we need-it’s mercy.
prayer: Merciful God, we acknowledge our sinful nature and our daily rebellion against You. Grant us Your undeserved mercy and forgiveness, not the judgment we truly deserve. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17668e429d5d080c
subject   : Subject: WHAT'S FAIR (12-16-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 15 Dec 2020 18:12:32 -0600
===================================================================

===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*When Adam sinned, sin entered the entire human*

*race. Adams sin brought death, so **death spread *

*to everyone, for everyone **sinned. *(Ro. 5:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

How can we be declared guilty for something

Adam did thousands of years ago? Many feel

it isn’t fair for God to judge us because of

Adam’s sin. Yet each of us confirms our her-

itage with Adam, by our sins every day. We

have the same sinful nature and are prone to

rebel against God, and we are judged for the

sins we commit. *Because we are **sinners, *

*it **isn’t fairness **we need—it’s mercy. *

* Pastor Sather*

subject: LOVE NEVER FAILS
verse:
Love is patient and kind. Love is not jealous or boastful  or proud or rude. Love does not demand its own way.  Love is not irritable, and it keeps no record of when it  has been wronged.
It is never glad about injustices but  rejoices whenever the truth wins out. Love never gives  up, never loses faith, is always hopeful, and endures  through every circumstance. Love will last forever.  (I Corinthians 13:4-8a)
reflection:
I believe we have all seen that our society often confuses Love and lust. Unlike lust, God’s kind of love is directed outward toward others not in ward toward ourselves. It is utterly unselfish. This kind of love goes against our natural inclinations. It is impossible to have this love unless God helps us set aside our own natural desires so that we can
love and not expect anything in return. The more we become like Christ, the more love we will show to others.
prayer: Holy God, help us to set aside our selfish desires and embrace Your selfless, outward-focused love that reflects the character of Christ. May we grow in our ability to love others unconditionally, without expectation of return, as we become more like You. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1766dae205aede58
subject   : Subject: LOVE NEVER FAILS (12-17-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 16 Dec 2020 16:31:37 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Love is patient and kind. Love is not jealous or boastful *

*or** proud or rude. Love does not demand its own way. *

*Love is** not irritable, and it keeps no record of when it *

*has been** wronged. It is never glad about injustices but *

*rejoices **whenever the truth wins out. Love never gives *

*up, never** loses faith, is always hopeful, and endures *

*through every** circumstance. Love will last forever. *

*(I Cor. 13:4-8a)*


*Today’s Reflection:*

I believe we have all seen that our society often

confuses Love and lust. Unlike lust, God’s kind

of love is directed outward toward others not in-

ward toward ourselves. It is utterly unselfish. This

kind of love goes against our natural inclinations.

It is impossible to have this love unless God helps

us set aside our own natural desires so that we can

love and not expect anything in return. *The more *

*we* * be**come like Christ, the more love we will *

*show to others.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: PERSISTENCE AYS OFF
verse: Keep on asking, and you will be given what you ask for.  Keep on looking, and you will find. Keep on knocking,  and the door will be opened. For everyone who asks,  receives. Everyone who seeks finds. And the door is  opened to everyone who knocks. (Matthew 7:7-8)
reflection: Jesus tells us to keep pursuing God. People often give up after a few halfhearted efforts and conclude that God cannot be found. But knowing God takes faith, focus, and follow through, and Jesus assures us that we will be rewarded. Don’t give up in your efforts to seek God Continue to ask Him for more. knowledge, patience, wisdom, love, and understanding. He will give them to you.
prayer: Faithful God, grant us the perseverance to seek You wholeheartedly, and the strength to continue asking for Your wisdom, love, and understanding, trusting in Your promise that we will be rewarded for our faithful pursuit. Help us to never give up in our efforts to know You more deeply. (AI)

*Today’s Verses:*

*Keep on asking, and you will be given what you ask for. *

*Keep on looking, and you will find. Keep on knocking, *

*and the door will be opened. For everyone who asks, *

*receives. Everyone who seeks finds. And the door is *

*opened to everyone who knocks. *(* Mt.*(7:7-8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus tells us to keep pursuing God. People often give

up after a few halfhearted efforts and conclude that God

cannot be found. But knowing God takes faith, focus,

and follow through, and Jesus assures us that we will

be rewarded. *Don’t give up in your efforts to seek God*

*Continue to ask Him for more*. *knowledge, patience, *

*wisdom, love, and under-standing. He will give them *

*to you.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: GOING NOWHERE
verse: Don’t worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will  bring its own worries. Today’s troubles is enough  for today. .(Matthew 6:34)
reflection:
Planning for tomorrow is time well spent; worrying about tomorrow is time wasted. Sometimes it's difficult to tell the difference.
Careful planning is thinking ahead about goals, steps, and schedules, and trust in God’s guidance. When done well, planning can alleviate worry. Worries, by contrast, are consumed by fear and find it difficult to trust God. Don’t let worries about tomorrow affect your relationship with God today. (Remember worry is like a rock ing chair, going back and forth and getting you nowhere.)
prayer: Gracious God, grant us the wisdom to plan thoughtfully for the future while trusting in Your divine guidance, and help us release our worries into Your capable hands. May we find peace in Your presence today, unburdened by fears of tomorrow. (AI)

*Don’t worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will *

*Today’s Reflection:*

Planning for tomorrow is time well spent; worrying

about tomorrow is time wasted. Sometimes *it's* difficult

to tell the difference. Careful planning is thinking

ahead about goals, steps, and schedules, and trust

in God’s guidance. When done well, planning can

alleviate worry. Worries, by contrast, are consumed

by fear and find it difficult to trust God. *Don’t let *

*worries about tomorrow affect your **relationship *

*with God today. (Remember worry is like **a rock-*

*ing **chair, going back and forth and getting you *

*no**where.) *

*Pastor Sather*

subject: GOD KEEPS HIS PROMISES
verse: Great is His faithfulness, His mercies begin afresh  each day. (Lamentations 3:23)
reflection: Jeremiah knew from experience about God’s faithfulness. God had promised that punishment would follow disobedience and it did. But God had also promised future restoration, and bless ing, and Jeremiah knew that God would keep that promise also. Trusting in God’s faithfulness day by day makes us confident in His great promises for the future.
prayer: Eternal God, as we reflect on Your unwavering faithfulness throughout history, help us trust in Your promises and find confidence in Your plan for our future. May we, like Jeremiah, remain steadfast in our faith, knowing that Your word endures forever. (AI)

subject: WELCOMING GOD’S SON
verse: The angel replied, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the  Most-High will overshadow you So the  baby born to you will be holy, and He  will be called the Son of God. (Luke 1:35)
reflection: Jesus was born without the sin that enter ed the world through Adam. He was born holy, just as Adam was created sinless. In contrast to Adam, who disobeyed God, Jesus obeyed God and was thus able to face sin’s consequences in our place and make us acc eptable to God. (Romans 5:14-19
prayer: Holy God, we thank You for sending Your Son Jesus, born without sin, to obey Your will perfectly and face the consequences of our transgressions. May we embrace the gift of righteousness through Christ and live in a way that honors His sacrifice. (AI)

subject: LIGHT IN OUR DARKNESS
verse: “Look, the virgin shall conceive and  bear a Son and they shall name Him, Emmanuel,” which means, God with  us”—(Matthew 1:23)
reflection:
Jesus was called to be Immanuel (“God with us”),
as predicted by Isaiah the prophet (Isaiah 7:14). Jesuswas God in the flesh; thus, God was literally among
us, “with us.” Through the Holy Spirit, Christ is present today in the life of every believer. Perhaps not even Isaiah understood how far-reaching the meaning of Immanuel would be.
prayer: Lord Jesus, we marvel at the profound fulfillment of Isaiah's prophecy in Your incarnation as Immanuel. May we continually recognize and embrace Your presence in our lives through the Holy Spirit, experiencing the deep comfort and transformative power of having God with us. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*“Look, the virgin shall conceive and *

*bear** a Son **and they shall name Him, Emmanuel,” **which **means, God
with *

*us”—*(Mt. 1:23)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus was called to be Immanuel

(“God with us”),

as predicted by Isaiah the prophet

(Isa. 7:14). Jesuswas God in the

flesh; thus, God was literally among

us, “with us.” Through the Holy Spirit, Christ is present today in the life
of

every believer. *Perhaps **not even *

*Isaiah understood how far-reaching*

*the meaning of Immanuel would be.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: POSSIBILITIES ARE ENDLESS
verse: Paul says, “I can do all things through Christ who  Strengthens me.” (Philippians 4:13)
reflection:
Can we really do everything? The power we receive
in union with Christ is sufficient to do His will and
to face challenges that arise from our commitment
to do it. He does not grant us superhuman ability
to accomplish anything we can imagine without
regard for His interests. As we contend for the faith,
we will face troubles, pressures, and trials. As they
come, ask Christ to strengthen you. Remember this-We have peace that passes understanding. We have joy that cannot be taken away. We have love that’s everlasting. We have nothing to fear and everything to hope for today, tomorrow, and always.
prayer: Faithful God, strengthen us to face the trials that come as we contend for Your truth, and remind us of the unshakable peace, joy, and love we have in You. Grant us the power to accomplish Your will and the courage to hope in You always. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 176923c832347071
subject   : Subject: POSSIBILITIES ARE ENDLESS
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 23 Dec 2020 18:53:28 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

Paul says, *“I can do all things through Christ who *

*Strengthens me*.” (Phil 4:13)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Can we really do everything? The power we receive

in union with Christ is sufficient to do His will and

to face challenges that arise from our commitment

to do it. He *does not* grant us superhuman ability

to accomplish any-thing we can imagine without

regard for His interests. As we contend for the faith,

we will face troubles, pressures, and trials. As they

come, ask Christ to strengthen you. *Remember*

*this—We have peace that passes understanding.*

*We have joy that cannot be taken away.*

*We have love that’s everlasting.*

*We have nothing to fear and everything to*

*hope for today, tomorrow, and always.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: THE SAVIOR IS BORN
verse: The people who waked in darkness have seen a  Great Light. (Isaiah 9:2)
reflection:
In a time of great darkness, God promised to send a light who would shine on everyone living in the shadow, in the shadow of death. He is both “Wonderful Counselor” and “Mighty God.” This message of hope was fulfilled in the birth of Christ and the establishment of His eternal kingdom. He came to deliver all people from their slavery to
sin. Because of this Christmas, there has been born a time of gift giving. But, really, Christmas is a gift itself, the never-failing reminder that, no matter what, God is with us every step of our journey through this life. (GOD BE WITH YOU AND YOURS IN THE COMING YEAR, WITH ALL THE QUESTIONS LOOMING IN LIFE.) Pastor & Marcie Sather
prayer: Almighty God, we thank You for the gift of Christmas and the light of Christ that shines in our darkness, delivering us from sin and reminding us of Your constant presence in our lives. Guide us through the coming year with Your wisdom and strength as we face life's uncertainties. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*The people who waked in darkness have seen a *

*Great Light. *(Isa. 9:2)



Today’s Reflection:

In a time of great darkness, God promised to send

a light who would shine on everyone living in the

shadow, in the shadow of death. He is both

“Wonderful Counselor” and “Mighty God.” This

message of hope was fulfilled in the birth of Christ

and the establishment of His eternal kingdom. He

came to deliver all people from their slavery to

sin. Because of this Christmas, there has been born

a time of gift giving. But, really, Christmas is a gift

itself, the never-failing reminder that, no matter

what, God is with us every step of our journey

through this life. (GOD BE WITH YOU AND YOURS

IN THE COMING YEAR, WITH ALL THE QUESTIONS

LOOMING IN LIFE.)

*Pastor & Marcie Sather*

subject: DIGGING DEEPER
verse: Sing a new song to the Lord! Let the whole earth  sing to the Lord! Sing to the Lord; bless His name.  Each day proclaim the good news that He saves. Publish His glorious deeds among the nations.  Tell everyone about the amazing things He does.  Great is the Lord! He is most worthy of praise!  He is to be revered above all the gods. (Psalm 96:1-4)
reflection:
The psalmist sings out his praises to God, overwhelmed by all that God has done. As we reflect on God’s majesty and His goodness to us, we can not help telling others about Him. Witnessing comes
naturally when our hearts are full of appreciation for what He has done.
God has chosen to use us to “publish His glorious deeds among the nations.” Praise for our great God overflows from His
creation and should overflow from our lips. How well are you doing at telling others about God’s greatness?
prayer: Holy God, fill our hearts with such overwhelming gratitude for Your majesty and goodness that we cannot help but proclaim Your glorious deeds to all nations. May our lips overflow with praise, and grant us the courage to share Your greatness with others. (AI)

deeds among the nations. *

*Tell **everyone about the amazing things He does. *

*Great is the Lord! **He is most worthy of praise! *

*Today’s Reflection:*

The psalmist sings out his praises to God, over-whelmed by all that God has
done. As we reflect

on God’s majesty and His goodness to us, we can-

not help telling others about Him. Witnessing comes

deeds among the nations.”

Praise for our great God overflows from His

creation and should overflow from our lips. *How *

* Pastor Sather*

subject: VISITORS FROM AFAR
verse: Jesus was born in the town of Bethlehem in Judea, during the reign of King Herod. About that time some wise  men from eastern lands arrived in Jerusalem, ask- ing, “Where is the newborn king of the Jews? We  have seen his star as it arose, and we have come  to worship him.” (Matthew 2:1-2)
reflection:
Astrologer normally called wise men traveled thousands of miles to see the king of the Jews. When they finally found him, they responded with joy, worship, and gifts. This is so different from the approach people often take today.
Most expect God to come looking for them to explain Himself, prove who He is, and give them gifts.
But those who are wise still seek and worship Jesus today, not for what they can get, but for who He really is.
prayer: Gracious God, guide us to seek You with the same devotion and humility as the wise men who journeyed far to worship the newborn King. May we approach You not with expectations of gain, but with hearts full of joy and reverence, offering our very lives as gifts to honor Your majesty. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verses:*

*Jesus was born in the town of Bethlehem in Judea, during*

*the reign of King Herod. About that time some wise *

*men **from eastern lands arrived in Jerusalem, ask-*

*ing, “Where **is the newborn king of the Jews? We *

*have seen his star **as it arose, and we have come *

*to worship him.” *(Mt. 2:1-2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Astrologer normally called wise men traveled

thousands of miles to see the king of the Jews.

When they finally found him, they responded

with joy, worship, and gifts. This is so different

from the approach people often take today. Most

expect God to come looking for them to explain

Himself, prove who He is, and give them gifts.

*But those who are wise still seek and worship *

*Jesus to**day, not for what they can get, but for *

*who He really **is.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: MEANING OF HOSPITALITY
verse: Continue to love each other with true Christian  love. Don’t forget to show hospitality to strangers,  for some have, who have entertained angels with- out realizing it! (Hebrews 13:1, 2)
reflection:
Three Old Testament people “entertained angels without realizing it.”(1) Abraham (Genesis 18:1ff) (2) Gideon (Jud. 6:1ff) (3)
Manoah (Jud. 13:2ff).
Some people say they cannot be hospitable be cause their homes are not large enough or nice enough. But even if you have no more than a table and two chairs in a rented room, there are people who would be grateful to spend time in your home. Are there visitors to your church with whom you could share a meal? Do you know single people who would enjoy an evening of conversation? Is there any way your home could meet the needs of traveling missionaries? Hospitality simply means making other people feel comfortable and at home.
prayer: Loving God, help us to open our hearts and homes to others, recognizing that true hospitality lies not in the grandeur of our surroundings but in the warmth of our welcome. May we be ever mindful of opportunities to share Your love through simple acts of kindness and fellowship. (AI)
original_content:

date      : Sun, 27 Dec 2020 17:28:56 -0600

*Today’s Reflection:*

Three Old Testament people “entertained angels

without realizing it.”(1) Abraham (Gen 18:1ff)

(2) Gideon (Jud. 6:1ff) (3) Manoah (Jud. 13:2ff).

Some people say they cannot be hospitable be-

cause their homes are not large enough or nice

enough. But even if you have no more than a table

and two chairs in a rented room, there are people

who would be grateful to spend time in your home.

Are there visitors to your church with whom you

could share a meal? Do you know single people

who would enjoy an evening of conversation? Is there any way your home
could meet the needs of traveling missionaries?

*Hospitality simply means making other people *

*feel comfortable and at** home.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: CONFIDENCE I GOD'S WILL
verse: Things were written in Scriptures long ago to  teach us.They give us hope and encouragement  as we wait patiently for God’s promises. (Romans 15:4)
reflection:
The knowledge of the scriptures affects our attitude
toward the present and the future. The more we know
about what God has done in years past, the greater the confidence we will have in what He will do in the days ahead.
We need to diligently read our Bibles so that we may have confidence that God’s will is best for us.
prayer: Faithful God, as we diligently study Your Word, deepen our understanding of Your past works and strengthen our trust in Your perfect will for our future. May our knowledge of Scripture cultivate an unwavering confidence in Your guidance for our lives. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Things were written in Scriptures long ago to *

*teach us.**They give us hope and encouragement *

*as we wait pat**iently for God’s promises. *(Ro. 15:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The knowledge of the scriptures affects our attitude

toward the present and the future. The more we know

about what God has done in years past, the greater

the confidence we will have in what He will do in the days ahead. *We need
to diligently read our Bibles so that **we may have confidence that God’s
will is best*

*for us.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: DILIGENT OBEDIENCE
verse:
Many will come from distant lands to rebuild the  temple of the Lord.
and when this happens, you  will know my messages have been from the Lord Almighty. All this will happen if you carefully obey the commands of the Lord. (Zechariah 6:15)
reflection:
Some of God’s promises are conditional-we must obey Him to receive them. The rebuilding of the tem ple required careful obedience.
God would protect the people as long as they obeyed. Casual or occas ional obedience, the result of a halfhearted or divided commitment, would not lead to blessings. Many of
God’s blessings come to us as a result of diligent obedience. Inconsistent obedience cannot produce consistent blessings.
prayer: Holy God, help us to obey You wholeheartedly and consistently, recognizing that Your blessings often flow from our diligent faithfulness. May we never settle for casual or halfhearted obedience, but instead strive to follow Your commands carefully and completely. (AI)
original_content:

subject   : Subject: DILIGENT OBEDIENCE (12-30-20)

date      : Tue, 29 Dec 2020 17:49:16 -0600

*Today’s Verse:*

*Many will come from distant lands to rebuild the *

*temple of the **Lord. and when this happens, you *

*will know my messages have **been from the Lord Almighty. All this will
happen if you carefully*

*obey the commands of the Lord. *(Zech. 6:15)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Some of God’s promises are conditional—we must obey Him to receive them.
The rebuilding of the tem-

ple required careful obedience. God would protect

the people as long as they obeyed. Casual or occas-

ional obedience, the result of a halfhearted or divided

commitment, would not lead to blessings. Many of

God’s blessings come to us as a result of diligent obedience*. **Inconsistent
obedience cannot produce consistent blessings.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: SURE SECUITY
verse: The Lord will be with thee, He will not fail thee,  neither Forsake thee, fear not, neither be dismayed. (Deuteronomy 31:8) NKJ
reflection:
Pilots put confidence in their planes. Commuters place their confidence in trains, cares, or busses. Each day we must put our confidence in something or someone. If you are willing trust a plane or a car to get you to your destination, are you willing to trust God to guide you here on earth and to your
eternal destination? Do you trust Him more than any human being? How futile it is to trust anything or anyone morethan God. Pastor Sather
prayer: Almighty God, grant us the wisdom to place our ultimate trust in You, recognizing that Your guidance surpasses all earthly means of transport or human wisdom. Help us to confidently surrender our lives and eternal destinies into Your capable hands, knowing that You alone are truly worthy of our complete faith. (AI)

Today’s Verse:

*The Lord will be with thee, He will not fail thee, *

*neither **Forsake thee, fear not, neither be dismayed. *(Deut. 31:8) NKJ



*Today’s Reflection:*

Pilots put confidence in their planes. Commuters

place their confidence in trains, cares, or busses.

Each day we must put our confidence in something

or someone. If you are willing trust a plane or a car

to get you to your destination, are you willing to

trust God to guide you here on earth and to your

eternal destination? Do you trust Him more than any human being? *How
futile it is to trust anything or anyone more**than God.*

*Pastor* *Sather*

subject: A GREAT INVITATION
verse: Come boldly to the throne of grace, that you may receive mercy, and find grace, for help in time of  need. (Hebrews 4:16)
reflection: What a wonderful thought; God the creator of all things invites us mere creatures to pray, and He assures us that He will hear. Great things can happen when we pray. We are commanded to pray by the one who loves us. We show Him our love by keeping His commandments. Yet knowing all this many of us pray so little! Let us pray more in 2021 so that things will be better than they were in 2020.
prayer: Gracious God, thank you for inviting us to pray and for assuring us that you hear our every word. Help us to deepen our love for you by praying more faithfully, trusting that through our prayers, you can bring about great change in our lives and in our world. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*Come boldly to the throne of grace, that you may receive **mercy, and find
grace, for help in time of *

*need. *(Heb. 4:16)



*Today’s Reflection:*

What a wonderful thought; God the creator of all

things invites us mere creatures to pray, and He

assures us that He will hear. Great things can happen when we pray. We are
commanded to pray by the one who loves us. We show Him our love by keeping
His commandments. *Yet knowing **all this many of us *

*pray so little! Let us pray more in 2021 **so that *

*things will be better than they were in 2020.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: PAUL'S FINAL ADVICE
verse: Always be joyful. Keep on praying. No matter what happens, always be thankful, for this is God’s will  for you who belong to Jesus Christ. (I Thessalonians 5:16, 17, 18)
reflection: Our joy, prayers, and thankfulness should not fluct uate with our circumstances or feelings. Obeying these three commands, be joyful, keep praying, and be thankful-often goes against our natural inclina tions. When we make a conscious decision to do what God says, however, we will begin to see people in a new perspective. When we do God’s will we find it easier to be joyful and thankful.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to cultivate a spirit of joy, prayer, and gratitude that remains steadfast regardless of our circumstances, and grant us the strength to obey your commands even when they challenge our natural inclinations. May our obedience to your will transform our perspective and draw us closer to you. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 176bb0909c927d54
subject   : Subject: PAUL'S FINAL ADVICE (1-1-2021)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 31 Dec 2020 17:01:40 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Always be joyful. Keep on praying. No matter what happens, **always be
thankful, for this is God’s will *

*for you who belong **to Jesus Christ. *(I Thess. 5:16,

17, 18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Our joy, prayers, and thankfulness should not fluct-

uate with our circumstances or feelings. Obeying

these three commands, be joyful, keep praying, and

be thankful—often goes against our natural inclina-

tions. When we make a conscious decision to do

what God says, however, we will begin to see people

in a new perspective*. When we do God’s will we *

*find it easier to **be joyful and thankful.*

* Pastor Sather*

*HAVE--A--BLESSED--NEW--YEAR*
